name: Grilled Steak Salad Bowls
description: There’s no such thing as a boring salad when it’s topped with juicy striploin. This one is so good, we made it into a whole meal! Striploin or ribeye steaks are a great choice because they’re full of flavour and easy to slice. Customize your way with your favourite veggies, seasonings (psst: Montreal Steak Rub), or Salad Dressings, and check out that Recipe Tip on how to put our fan-favourite Teppanyaki Sauce Mix to use!

ingredients.name: grilling steak, such as top sirloin, striploin or ribeye
Creamy Potato Salad Dressing Mix or Lemon Dilly Dip Mix

preparation: Meanwhile, coat both sides of steak with 1 tsp oil; rub in 1 tbsp dressing mix. Let stand to marinate while preparing remaining ingredients.
For dressing, in a large mixing bowl, whisk together remaining 1 tbsp dressing mix and vinegar with remaining 2 tbsp oil.
Cut tomatoes in half, and then add to bowl with dressing. Add corn and feta; toss to mix. Place greens on top; don’t mix. Set aside.
Place steak on grill; close lid and grill to desired doneness, about 3 min per side for medium rare.

Remove to a cutting board, if you have extra time, let steak rest about 2-3 min before slicing (this keeps it juicy). Thinly slice, and then add to bowl with salad; toss well so dressing is evenly mixed. Divide salad between four plates; add toppings, if desired.
tips: Level up! Thin out prepared Teppanyaki Sauce with a splash of milk and drizzle it over your salad bowl.
perfectlyBalanceYourPlate: This is a perfectly balanced plate.

products.name: Lemon Dilly Dip Mix
summary: Beyond being one of our most-loved kid-friendly dips – they love it for dunking chicken strips, fish bites, and veggies – Lemon Dilly is all about versatility. With loads of dill and a hint of lemon zest, it makes an utterly delicious tzatziki and spread for burgers and sandwiches, and levels up everything from salad dressing and salmon to pasta and vegetables.
